sentences: Lapsed ei suuda veel kõiki sõnu mõista.
context: The Estonian word 'suudavad' is the 3rd person plural present tense form of the verb 'suidama', which means 'to be able to' or 'can'. It indicates that someone/something has the ability or capability to do something. In the dictionary definition provided, it appears in a sentence about insectivorous plants being able to catch and digest small animals, showing how this word expresses capacity or possibility.
